## About Me

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(grid)

sierpinski <- function(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, depth) {
  if(depth == 0) {
    grid.polygon(x = unit(c(x1, x2, x3), "npc"), 
                 y = unit(c(y1, y2, y3), "npc"),
                 gp = gpar(col = "black"))
    return()
  }
  
  # Calculate the midpoints of the sides of the triangle
  xm1 <- (x1 + x2) / 2
  ym1 <- (y1 + y2) / 2
  xm2 <- (x2 + x3) / 2
  ym2 <- (y2 + y3) / 2
  xm3 <- (x1 + x3) / 2
  ym3 <- (y1 + y3) / 2
  
  # Recursively draw the three outer triangles
  sierpinski(x1, y1, xm1, ym1, xm3, ym3, depth - 1)
  sierpinski(x2, y2, xm1, ym1, xm2, ym2, depth - 1)
  sierpinski(x3, y3, xm2, ym2, xm3, ym3, depth - 1)
}

# Define the vertices of the main triangle
x1 <- 0.05
y1 <- 0.05
x2 <- 0.95
y2 <- 0.05
x3 <- 0.5
y3 <- 0.95

# Define the depth of recursion (number of iterations)
depth <- 10

# Call the function to draw the Sierpinski Triangle
sierpinski(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, depth)
```
